meta.hint: Some verbs tell you about something that has already happened. These verbs tell you about the past. They usually end in -ed. eg. We walked to the shops yesterday. eg. The show started last week.  Some verbs tell you about something that is happening now.  These verbs tell you about the present. They usually have no  end, or they end in -s. We walk to school today. eg. The show starts now.  Some verbs tell you about something that is going to happen.  These verbs tell you about the future. They use the word will. We will walk to the park next week. eg. The party will start soon.

content.description: Which sentence tells you about the past?
content.extra: She smiled at us, She cleans her room every day.

content.description: Which sentence tells you about the past?
content.extra: They called the Police,  We will watch the movie.
